rComments: If you're in Rotman, you can't avoid RSM100, but READ THIS FOR ADVICE. He will test you on his exact words and not student participation: A TA said for 1 midterm question, 4/1000 students (RSM100+MGT100+other campus) got it right. Grading is inconsistent: a friend got a 60% on a project, and then got it changed to a 80%.

Prof. Khan is the most interesting and inspirational professor that you will meet in Rotman! He teaches engagingly and is very passionate. Though he gives extremely content based and hard tests, I like that he actually test the knowledge of his students and what they learned from interesting case studies. He is a prof you will want to take again!
Prof Khan is strict, but I learned a lot from his lectures, both knowledge of management and the attitude towards matters. He is a nice person, but hard to access to him after lectures.

Arrogant . Also wants us to purchase the book he specifically wrote, plus some extra software subscription to online resources he has incentives to (that never really helped students tbh). Attend lectures then teach yourself. Unreasonable. Takes attendance when lecture starts and not after the 10-minute travelling allowance UofT implemented
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy']

rComments: Prof Khan is a very humorous man, but his lecture was all about cases and only few textbook material. You really need to study everything on yourself. AND he also have the strangest and roughest grading policy. I really don't know what happen to my final:(
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: If youre taking rsm100, go to the lectures and TAKE NOTES. Super lecture heavy. Everything from the lectures are on tests. Grading is kind of wack and seems like they bell curve down.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Brags all the time. Does not teach. Keep on skipping slides. You have to self teach yourself everything.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: He appears to be very friendly and a generally understanding guy but he is anything of the sort. Khan is full of himself and believes to be a very good teacher, and thus a very good contact for his students- he even took the liberty of bragging about all his students and their successes because of him. We don't get to check our exams to improve!
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: A smug professor who believes he is much better than he is. Made me drop 15% after finals. Requested to review my test after, from his abysmal comments, it seems like he only read the first two sentences and determined my mark. Very disappointing experience.
He was okay. Lectures were quite funny and explanations were clear. Not amazing but not bad!
He's rude and I wouldn't be taking this class if it weren't a mandatory one.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']
